p.s: In his latest article John Worne claims that language learning is vital for the UK's future prosperity and global standing which I think is only partially right as he presented it.
It may not be essential for the UK's global standing, which doesn't mean it's not important.

With globalisation processing more and more the English language as the worldsworld's official language is spread more and more throughout the world and most people, especially those trying to do business, can already speak English which leads to the conclusion that the UK's position isn't in big danger in the near future.
That doesn't mean that just because not everything is going downhill it's not important to learn foreign languages.
In my opinion it's also a valid point that learning a foreign language helps to get to know other cultures and to teach cultural awareness.
In my opinion it's also ignorant to just expect that everyone is learning your own language and on the other hand not willing to learn other languages.

Another aspect to be considered is that fast developing nations like e. g. China gain more and more influence in the world which also leads to chineseChinese being more spoken in the world which is why English might not be the only world language for everforever.

To also look at the point that many UK businesses now require foreign language skills and that it is easier to find a job so one could say that it is certainly not necessary to now have other language knowledge but it is giving one advantages when looking for a job.
In conclusion I can say that the learning of foreign languages is more and more required to find a job but it is still not a necessity.
